choices.D: The privilege SYSREPL has been introduced for ACFS replication.
choices.E: One site of an ACFS replication configuration can host both primary and standby file systems.
choices.B: ACFS auditing information is replicated from the primary file system to the standby file system.
choices.A: Replication is automatically terminated if the primary file system has less than 2 GB free space.
choices.C: Standby redo log files are required on the standby site for synchronous redo transport.

questions.question_text: Which three statements are true about ASM Cloud File System (ACFS) replication? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ABE
A. Correct: ACFS replication requires a minimum of 2 GB free space on the primary file system to ensure proper functioning and prevent data consistency issues.
B. Correct: ACFS replication can include auditing information as part of the metadata it replicates, ensuring that the audit trail is maintained on the standby system. But it's important to clarify what this entails and how it fits into the overall ACFS replication process.
E. Correct: ACFS replication allows for a flexible deployment where a single site can host both primary and standby file systems, useful for testing or staging environments.

C. Incorrect: This pertains to Oracle Data Guard, not ACFS replication. While ACFS can replicate redo log files stored in the file system, it does not specifically require standby redo log files for its replication process.
D. Incorrect: There is no SYSREPL privilege mentioned in Oracle's documentation for ACFS replication. Standard administrative privileges are used to manage ACFS replication configurations.

Selected Answer: ABE
There is no SYSREPL privilege
This question is only about ACFS Replication, there is nothing that references to redo log files

comments.content: This questions is about ACFS, not dataguard.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ABE
I think D is wrong - there is no SYSREPL privilege

Selected Answer: BDE
I think BDE.

choices.A: Cluster resources running on the failed node must be recovered when the node is restarted.
choices.B: Cluster Resources running on the failed node are relocated to one or more surviving hub nodes.
choices.E: The node is evicted from the cluster.
choices.C: Cluster Resources running on the failed node are suspended until the node is restarted.
choices.D: Sessions connected to the failed node could be relocated to one or more surviving nodes.

questions.question_text: Which three events occur when a node fails in an Oracle Clusterware 19c Cluster? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
In summary, the colocation_tag attribute is used to provide a hint to the listener to route clients with the same tag to the same instance in an Oracle RAC environment. This is done to improve data locality and reduce inter-instance communication by grouping clients that are likely to access the same data.

questions.question_text: Which statement describes the purpose of colocation_tag for client routing with Oracle database 19c?

choices.D: When possible, clients with the same colocation_tag are routed to the same available instance when a preferred instance is not available.
choices.B: When possible, clients with the same colocation_tag are routed to the same available instance even if a preferred instance is available.
choices.A: When possible, clients with the same colocation_tag are routed to the same instance that offers a given service.
choices.C: When possible, clients with the same colocation_tag could be routed across a set of preferred instances based on a specific load balancing option.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AEF
AEF is correct

Selected Answer: AEF
Correct Statements:
A. Necessary for passwordless SSH connectivity between nodes during installation.
E. Oracle RAC is a feature of the Enterprise Edition, not available in the Standard Edition.
F. Oracle ACFS (ASM Cluster File System) is supported for RAC installations.

Incorrect Statements:
B. Fix-up scripts are related to configuration checks and prerequisites, not directly a part of the RAC software installation.
C. RAC software is typically installed in shared storage, not local file systems.
D. While shared storage is required, it doesn't have to be a traditional cluster file system; ASM is also supported.
G. This implies local installations on each node, which is not accurate as RAC is installed on shared storage.

Selected Answer: ABF
ABF correct, Rac 19c is support standart edition 2.

comments.content:
Yes you write i make mistake ABF correct, Standart edition 2(se2) is no longer supporting Oracle 19c RAC.

Starting with Oracle Database 19c, Oracle Real Application Clusters (Oracle RAC) is not supported in Oracle Database Standard Edition 2 (SE2).
Real Application Clusters (RAC) is not support Oracle Database Standard Edition 2 (SE2) (Doc ID 2504078.1)

discussion.content: ABF , E is wrong, Standard Edition is possible as well.

comments.content: not in 19c. It's not RAC, its SEHA now.

questions.question_text: Which three statements are true about an Oracle Database RAC software installation? (Choose three.)

choices.E: RAC installations require Oracle Enterprise Edition.
choices.C: The software must be installed into a local file system on each node.
choices.A: SSH user equivalence for the Oracle user can be set up before the software installation.
choices.D: The software must be installed into a cluster file system.
choices.G: The software must be installed on all nodes in the cluster.
choices.F: The software can be installed into an ACFS file system.
choices.B: Fix-up scripts generated during the installation must be run as root on UNIX platforms.

questions.question_text: Which two statements are true about initialization parameters for Clustered ASM instances? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AD
A: T 1024 
B: F Default is RDBMS
C: F
D: T Optional
E: F It's for disk rebalancing power in the ASM instance

Selected Answer: AD
https://docs.oracle.com/en/database/oracle/oracle-database/19/refrn/ASM_POWER_LIMIT.html
ASM_POWER_LIMIT increased maximum value to 1024 from 11.2.0.2

Selected Answer: BD
Correct: B (The default value of INSTANCE_TYPE is ASM) and D (The ASM_DISKGOUPS parameter is optional).
Incorrect: A (Maximum value of ASM_POWER_LIMIT is 11, not 1024), C (Changes to ASM_DISKSTRING do not require a restart), and E (ASM_POWER_LIMIT controls rebalance power, not RDBMS instance access).

B is not correct
Looks like AD

choices.A: The maximum value of ASM_POWER_LIMIT is 1024.
choices.C: A change to ASM_DISKSTRING requires a restart of all ASM instances for the change to take effect.
choices.E: ASM_POWER_LIMIT controls the number of RDBMS instances that can access a disk group while it is being rebalanced.
choices.B: The default value of INSTANCE_TYPE is ASM.
